faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca remains an excellent property investment region. The area has experienced consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation, with San Miguel de Salinas outperforming many coastal towns. Strong rental demand from holiday visitors, established international communities, excellent weather (320+ sunny days annually), and access to quality healthcare and education make it particularly attractive for families. Property prices are significantly lower than comparable properties in other European destinations.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-Spanish citizens can purchase property freely in Spain without restrictions. Foreign buyers have identical rights to Spanish nationals when purchasing residential property. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and should engage a local gestor (property management expert) to handle paperwork. Many residents purchase via Spanish limited companies for tax efficiency, though primary residences have particular advantages.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property purchase price, expect approximately 8-10% in additional costs. This includes transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (approximately 1%), property registration (approximately 0.5%), and gestor fees (approximately 1-2%). In Alicante, transfer tax is 6%. These are one-time costs. Annual ongoing costs include property tax (approximately 0.4-1.1% of property value) and optional community fees if applicable (this villa has none).

faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerende voorheffing in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI—Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles) ranges from 0.4% to 1.1% of the registered property value, varying by municipality and region. San Miguel de Salinas typically falls in the lower range. This is significantly cheaper than UK Council Tax. You'll pay this annually to the local municipality. Additionally, stamp duty on purchase ranges from 6-10% depending on region (6% in Alicante).

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain mortgages from Spanish banks, though requirements differ from Spanish nationals. Most banks require 30-50% deposit and proof of income. Interest rates are competitive (typically 3-4% for 20-year terms). You'll need a Spanish tax number (NIE) and possibly Spanish employment or income documentation. Many foreign buyers work with international mortgage brokers who specialize in Spanish property finance. Currency exchange rates should be considered carefully.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is significantly lower than UK equivalents. Grocery shopping costs approximately 20-30% less, utilities are considerably cheaper, and eating out is excellent value (menu del día lunch sets €9-15). Healthcare costs are minimal due to low-cost private insurance or government system access. Childcare and education fees are substantially lower than UK private schools. Overall monthly living costs for a family can be 30-40% less than comparable UK towns.

faqs.question: Is San Miguel de Salinas good for families?
faqs.answer: Excellent. San Miguel de Salinas has become increasingly popular with international families specifically. Multiple international schools nearby offer British curriculum education, healthcare is outstanding with English-speaking doctors, and the established expat community provides built-in social networks. Beaches are 15-20 minutes away, and the safe, quiet neighbourhood is ideal for children. Lower living costs mean families can afford larger homes, better schools, and more leisure activities than in the UK.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van België?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport is 45 km from San Miguel de Salinas (45 minutes by car). Direct flights from UK airports to Alicante take approximately 2.5 hours from London Gatwick/Luton, with connections to Manchester, Birmingham, and regional airports. Multiple daily flights mean visiting family is straightforward. Many British expats fly home quarterly, and children often visit grandparents for school holidays.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with over 320 sunny days annually. Summers are warm (28-32°C June-August), winters are mild (10-16°C December-February), and rainfall is minimal. The area rarely experiences extreme temperatures or severe weather. Spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November) are particularly pleasant. This climate allows year-round outdoor living, significantly reduces heating costs, and contributes to the healthy lifestyle many expatriate families seek.
